intro: Jussiaea lamprotes, commonly known as the silverleaf waterplantain, is a flowering plant species native to wetland habitats in South America. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, silver-haired leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, often emerging from water or moist soil. Its roots are adapted for aquatic environments, allowing it to thrive in marshes and shallow water bodies. Jussiaea lamprotes plays a role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for aquatic invertebrates.
